text: This is a terrible way to treat graduate students, and an even worse way to communicate the decision. https://t.co/8y0jZmvzGr
@lisagiven @Swinburne Quite possibly as meaningful as any of the "official" rankings too.

Wonderful piece in the Guardian with reflections from two of my favourite artists and thinkers. Great meditations on technocracy and serendipity, for those of us interested in such things. https://t.co/J4diFTZblu

OK, it might be 20 past 8 on a Friday and me just leaving my desk, but I really, really like working at (for? I've only been in twice!) @RMITComputing. Today I've had two interesting meetings and seen a great seminar, and every single person I dealt with was collegial and kind.
@jschneider That is a very good point--the copyright changing is pretty different to a retraction because of plagiarism or correction of incorrect data for example
